skill.name: tikzjax-diagramming
skill.description: Create TikZ diagrams in Obsidian using TikZJax plugin. Use when visualizing geometric shapes, coordinate systems, game scenes, circuit diagrams, chemical structures, or complex technical drawings that require precise positioning.
skill.summary: Create TikZ diagrams in Obsidian using TikZJax plugin. Use when visualizing geometric shapes, coordi...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference material for TikZ syntax. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no system commands. The skill provides LaTeX/TikZ diagram examples for Obsidian users.

content.value_statement: Generate precise technical drawings in Obsidian that exceed Mermaid limitations. Create geometric shapes, coordinate systems, circuit diagrams, chemical structures, and 3D plots using LaTeX TikZ syntax rendered by the TikZJax plugin.
actual_capabilities: Generate TikZ code blocks for geometric shapes and coordinate systems
Create circuit diagrams with circuitikz package syntax
Draw chemical structures using chemfig notation
Build commutative diagrams with tikz-cd syntax
Render 3D plots and data visualizations with pgfplots
Use dark mode color adaptation for theme compatibility
limitations: Requires TikZJax Obsidian plugin to be installed
Color mixing syntax like blue!30 is not supported
Korean text and special characters are not supported
Custom RGB/HTML colors are not inverted in dark mode

use_cases.title: Technical Documentation
use_cases.description: Create precise diagrams for technical documentation that require exact positioning and mathematical accuracy

use_cases.title: Educational Materials
use_cases.description: Build circuit diagrams, mathematical visualizations, and chemistry structures for teaching materials

use_cases.title: Research Figures
use_cases.description: Generate publication-quality diagrams including coordinate systems, 3D plots, and data visualizations

prompt_templates.title: Basic Rectangle
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a TikZ diagram with a simple rectangle containing text using tikzjax-diagramming syntax

prompt_templates.title: Coordinate System
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate TikZ code for a 2D coordinate system with labeled axes and a marked point using tikzjax-diagramming

prompt_templates.title: Circuit Diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a circuit diagram with a resistor, capacitor, and voltage source using circuitikz syntax from tikzjax-diagramming

prompt_templates.title: Commutative Diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a commutative diagram with four nodes and labeled arrows using tikz-cd from tikzjax-diagramming

output_examples.input: Create a simple TikZ rectangle diagram
output: Use a tikz code block with \begin{document} and \end{document} wrapper
Add text labels using \node at (x,y) {text}; syntax
For dark mode compatibility, omit explicit color specifications

best_practices: Always include \begin{document} and \end{document} in your tikz code blocks
Use scale=1 for optimal text readability in diagrams
Omit explicit color in \node commands to enable automatic dark mode adaptation
Load additional packages like circuitikz or chemfig with \usepackage{} before \begin{document}
anti_patterns: Using color mixing syntax like blue!30 which is not supported
Including Korean or non-ASCII text which breaks rendering
Setting scale less than 1 which reduces text readability
Forgetting the \begin{document} wrapper which causes rendering failure

faq.question: Does TikZJax work with Obsidian mobile apps?
faq.answer: TikZJax diagrams render on mobile but complex diagrams may have performance limitations.

faq.question: What is the maximum diagram complexity supported?
faq.answer: Complexity limits depend on device resources. Simple to moderate diagrams render reliably.

faq.question: How do I install TikZJax in Obsidian?
faq.answer: Install via Obsidian Community Plugins browser and enable the plugin in settings.

faq.question: Is my diagram data stored externally?
faq.answer: No. TikZJax renders diagrams locally using browser JavaScript. No data leaves your device.

faq.question: Why is my diagram not rendering?
faq.answer: Common causes: missing \begin{document}, syntax errors, unsupported color mixing, or missing package declarations.

faq.question: How does TikZJax compare to Mermaid?
faq.answer: TikZJax offers superior precision for geometry and mathematics. Mermaid is better for flowcharts and simple diagrams.
